item.title: 小型飞机坠入巴西城市，击中居民区
item.description: 据当地政府称，一架小型飞机在巴西南部南里奥格兰德州的格拉玛多市坠毁。该州州长爱德华多-莱特（Eduardo Leite）在 X 网站上发文称，乘客似乎都已遇难。【原文：A small airplane crashed in the Brazilian city of Gramado, in the southern Rio Grande do Sul state, according to local authorities. It appears that the passengers didn’t survive, the state’s governor, Eduardo Leite, said in a post on X.】

item.title: 国家电视台报道：普京与斯洛伐克总统菲佐在莫斯科举行会谈
item.description: 据俄罗斯国家电视台 Rossiya 24 频道报道，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京正在莫斯科与斯洛伐克总理罗伯特-菲佐举行会谈。【原文：Russian President Vladimir Putin is holding talks with Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico in Moscow, state TV channel Rossiya 24 reported.】

item.title: 债券交易员在数十年来最痛苦的宽松政策中转向 2025 年
item.description: 债券交易员很少因美联储的宽松周期而遭受如此大的损失。现在，他们担心 2025 年可能会出现更多同样的情况。【原文：Bond traders have rarely suffered so much from a Federal Reserve easing cycle. Now they fear 2025 threatens more of the same.】

item.title: 在 ChatGPT 首次亮相两年后，人工智能 "马路杀手 "的担忧一直困扰着交易者
item.description: ChatGPT 的崛起引发了人们对人工智能的担忧，各种类型的企业都深受其害。聊天机器人发布两年后，其结果并没有像一些投资者预测的那样带来灾难性的影响。但焦虑情绪依然不减。【原文：The rise of ChatGPT sparked fears about artificial intelligence roiling businesses of all kinds. Two years after the chatbot’s release, the results haven’t been nearly as cataclysmic as some investors predicted. But there’s still plenty of anxiety.】

item.title: 对新兴市场而言，"明年运气会更好 "很难让人相信
item.description: 过去一年，以新兴市场为重点的投资者几乎没有什么值得庆祝的事情。过去十年也是如此。现在，唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）关税和贸易战的前景让一些人考虑完全放弃新兴市场。【原文：Emerging markets-focused investors have had little to celebrate over the past year. Or for that matter, over the past decade. Now the prospect of Donald Trump’s tariffs and trade wars has some considering abandoning them altogether.】

item.title: 法国对意大利金融业的举动引发罗马担忧
item.description: 意大利政府越来越担心法国在其金融业中的影响力增加的前景，正在进行的两笔重大交易可能会重塑意大利金融市场。【原文：The Italian government is growing concerned about the prospect of an increased French presence in its finance industry, with two major deals in the works that could potentially reshape the market.】

item.title: 研究发现：南非在经济增长数据中对农业的计算不足
item.description: 南非最大的农场工业游说团体称，对统计机构方法的调查显示，今年的农业萎缩并没有报告的那么严重，并呼吁对计算方法进行改革。【原文：South Africa’s biggest farm-industry lobby said a probe into the statistics agency’s methods showed that agriculture hadn’t contracted as much as reported this year and called for a reform of the calculations.】

item.title: 欧洲大型股票在美国巨型股票的阴影下越缩越深
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）股价暴跌 930 亿美元，给欧洲最大的上市公司带来了最新的打击。【原文：A $93 billion plunge in Novo Nordisk A/S shares has provided the latest blow to Europe’s largest listed companies, which have spent another year struggling in vain to match the returns of Wall Street’s biggest stocks.】

item.title: 对英国统计局调查的质疑波及国内生产总值数据
item.description: 同样的调查失败曾让英国无法确定劳动力的数量，现在又让人怀疑英国的经济规模。【原文：The same kind of survey failures that have left the UK unsure about the number of people in Britain’s workforce are now raising doubts about the size of its economy.】

item.title: 印度正迎来九十年代式的股票飙升期
item.description: 按百分比计算，20 世纪 90 年代末美国股市的繁荣仍是有史以来最大的繁荣，并帮助丰富了整整一代投资者。使这一涨势成为可能的关键因素之一正在印度生根发芽。【原文：The boom in US stocks during the late 1990s still ranks as the biggest ever in percentage terms, and helped enrich a whole generation of investors. One of the key ingredients that made the rally possible is taking root in India.】

item.title: 苹果公司的 10 亿美元投资对印尼来说可能只是短暂的胜利
item.description: 苹果公司提出将在印尼的投资额提高到 10 亿美元，以促使印尼总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）的政府取消 iPhone 16 的销售禁令，印尼因此取得了胜利。这一胜利可能是短暂的。【原文：Indonesia claimed victory after Apple Inc. offered to increase its investment in the country to $1 billion to get President Prabowo Subianto’s government to lift a ban on the sale of iPhone 16s. The win may be short-lived.】

item.title: 日本人债务缠身，破产和自杀人数上升
item.description: 随着利率的提高和生活成本的上升，越来越多的日本人被个人债务压得喘不过气来。【原文：Personal debt is overwhelming an increasing number of Japanese as higher interest rates and the rising cost of living bite.】

item.title: 特朗普要求巴拿马降低过境费或将运河归还美国
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周六表示，巴拿马运河对美国海军和商船收取 "过高的价格和通行费"，他要求降低收费，否则巴拿马就应将运河归还给美国。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump said Saturday that the Panama Canal is charging “exorbitant prices and rates of passage” on US naval and merchant ships, and he demanded that fees be lowered or else Panama should return the canal to the US.】

item.title: 危机进入第五个年头，中国房地产危机再起
item.description: 中国领先的开发商之一正因违约风险而受到当局的关注。香港一家大型建筑商正在要求贷款人延长贷款期限。另一家业内同行正在出售北京一家标志性但基本空置的商场。【原文：One of China’s leading developers is now on authorities’ radar for default risk. A major Hong Kong builder is asking lenders to extend loans. Another industry peer is selling an iconic but largely empty mall in Beijing.】

item.title: 信贷质量出现触顶迹象
item.description: 2022 年，美联储以数十年来最快的速度开始加息后，一些美国蓝筹公司发誓要开始削减债务负担。现在，这些日子可能已经结束了。【原文：In 2022, after the Federal Reserve started raising rates at the fastest pace in decades, some blue-chip US companies vowed to start cutting their debt loads. Those days may be over now.】

item.title: 武契奇告诉《HRT1》：欧洲央行明年将继续降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员鲍里斯-武伊契奇（Boris Vujcic）表示，欧洲中央银行将在 2025 年继续降低借贷成本。【原文：The European Central Bank will go on lowering borrowing costs in 2025, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic.】

item.title: 瑞士电信收购沃达丰意大利公司获当局批准
item.description: Swisscom AG 已获得意大利竞争监管机构和工业部批准收购沃达丰意大利公司。【原文：Swisscom AG has received clearance to acquire Vodafone Italia from both the Italian competition regulator and Industry Ministry.】

item.title: 阿尔巴尼亚禁止 TikTok 至少一年：阿尔巴尼亚日报
item.description: 阿尔巴尼亚每日新闻》周六援引阿尔巴尼亚总理埃迪-拉马（Edi Rama）在首都地拉那的一次教师和家长集会上发表的言论报道称，阿尔巴尼亚政府禁止使用 TikTok 至少一年。【原文：Albania’s government banned TikTok for at least a year, Albanian Daily News reported on Saturday, citing comments by Prime Minister Edi Rama to a gathering of teachers and parents in the capital Tirana.】

item.title: 巴西财政部削减修订财政计划中的节余估算
item.description: 在巴西参议院周五批准了总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）的紧缩计划后，巴西财政部下调了该计划的预算节余预测。【原文：Brazil’s Finance Ministry reduced its forecast of budget savings from President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s austerity plan after the country’s Senate approved on Friday a watered-down version of the program.】

item.title: 为什么 OpenAI 和 SpaceX 等公司会长期保持私有状态？
item.description: 私营公司，尤其是科技公司，正在筹集数十亿美元，以推迟，有时甚至回避进入公开市场。这些努力为员工和早期阶段的利益相关者创造了大量财富，却把大多数无法通过一些美国公司提供的 401（k）退休账户等方式进行投资的人拒之门外。与几十年前相比，这些数字显示了巨大的变化，而随着首次公开募股（IPO）的增加，这一趋势变得更加明显。【原文：Private companies — especially those in tech — are raising billions of dollars to delay, and sometimes even shun, a path to public markets. These efforts are creating vast wealth for employees and early-stage stakeholders, while shutting out most people who can’t invest in them through things such as 401(k) retirement accounts provided by some US companies. The numbers show a dramatic shift from just a few decades ago, and the trend has become even more stark as initial public offerings (IPOs) h】

item.title: 有其父必有其子：二人在美国就业数据预测者中名列前茅
item.description: 看看最新美国就业报告排名第一的预测者是 Natixis North America LLC 的 Jonathan Pingle。【原文：Take a look at the top-ranked forecaster for the latest US jobs report and you’ll see Jonathan Pingle of Natixis North America LLC.】

item.title: 据天空电视台报道，英国央行行长贝利、英国金融监管局局长拉蒂将与里夫斯一同访华
item.description: 据英国天空新闻（Sky News）周六报道，英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）将陪同英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）于 1 月份对中国进行正式访问。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey will accompany Britain’s Finance Minister Rachel Reeves on her official visit to China in January, Sky News reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 微小但重要的金属市场急于适应中国打压政策
item.description: 中国限制向美国出口三种利基金属已经令市场哗然。现在，更大规模的打击看来将对美国国防和芯片制造行业的供应链产生深远影响。【原文：Chinese curbs on exports of three niche metals to the US have already rattled the market. Now, a bigger clampdown looks set to have far-reaching ramifications for supply chains feeding American defense and chip-making industries.】

item.title: 欧尔班誓言在 2026 年投票前实行财政纪律以安抚市场
item.description: 匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）周六表示，匈牙利必须维持财政纪律，以避免市场动荡，即使在明年议会选举竞选活动升温时也是如此。【原文：Hungary must maintain fiscal discipline to avoid market turbulence even when parliamentary election campaigning heats up next year, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said Saturday.】

item.title: 马斯克的特朗普交易让特斯拉成为 5700 亿美元大涨的赢家
item.description: 不到两个月前，特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.但经过过去七周的疯狂反弹，该股突然跻身 2024 年 S&P 500 指数表现最好的股票之列。【原文：Less than two months ago, shares of Tesla Inc. were on their way to just the third losing year in the electric-vehicle maker’s decade-and-a-half as a public company. But after a furious rally in the last seven weeks, the stock is suddenly among the S&P 500 Index’s best performers for 2024.】

item.title: 华尔街周刊统计数据和竞争中的利弊权衡
item.description: 欢迎收看《华尔街一周》时事通讯，我们将在彭博电视上与全球华尔街的一些精英对话，为您提供一些投资方面的思考。本周，我们与同事莫莉-史密斯（Molly Smith）和马克斯-拉姆齐（Max Ramsay）讲述了美国统计数据侵蚀的实地影响，以及欧盟在增长与竞争之间的权衡。如果您还不是订阅者，请在此注册订阅本新闻通讯。【原文：Welcome to the Wall Street Week newsletter, giving you some investing food for thought from our conversations on Bloomberg Television with some of the best minds on Global Wall Street. item.title: 欧尔班称匈牙利努力保持乌克兰天然气过境通道畅通
item.description: 匈牙利总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）表示，匈牙利正在寻求一种解决方案，一旦莫斯科与基辅之间的现有过境合同到期，将允许天然气继续通过乌克兰流向欧洲。【原文：Hungary is seeking a solution that would allow gas flows to Europe via Ukraine to continue once the current transit contract between Moscow and Kyiv expires, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行签署 51 亿欧元收购安盛资产管理公司的协议
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）以 51 亿欧元（53 亿美元）完成了对 Axa SA 资产管理部门的收购，这是首席执行官让-洛朗-邦纳费（Jean-Laurent Bonnafe）领导下的最大一笔收购。【原文：BNP Paribas SA finalized the €5.1 billion ($5.3 billion) purchase of Axa SA’s asset management unit, in the biggest acquisition under Chief Executive Officer Jean-Laurent Bonnafe.】

item.title: 香港可能成为特朗普与中国斗争的新热点
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普上次入主白宫时打破了许多经济政策惯例。不过，他没有对香港的联系汇率采取行动。【原文：Donald Trump broke a whole lot of economic-policy conventions when last he was in the White House. One he stopped short of, however, was action against Hong Kong’s pegged-exchange rate.】
